content.raw:
The `UNIT_ImagesView_TEST` failed in the [most recent homebrew build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/75/testReport/junit/UNIT_ImagesView_TEST/xml/_empty_/). Here's a summary:

## [Default branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/28/testReport/UNIT_ImagesView_TEST/xml/_empty_/)

On default, it fails with a timeout:

~~~
163/490 Test #163: UNIT_ImagesView_TEST ..................................***Timeout 249.17 sec
~~~

## This branch

In my first jenkins test, it [passed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/72/testReport/%28root%29/ImagesView_TEST/). In the most recent build, [it failed](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/75/testReport/junit/UNIT_ImagesView_TEST/xml/_empty_/), but it was a failure caused by an exception rather than a timeout:

~~~
163: Assertion failed: (!res), function ~mutex, file /Users/jenkins/jenkins.i7st/include/boost/thread/pthread/mutex.hpp, line 111.
163/490 Test #163: UNIT_ImagesView_TEST ..................................***Exception: Other308.26 sec
~~~

 I believe this test will still fail intermittently for some reason, but we can address that at a later time. I believe the timeout increase in this branch is justified, despite this recent failure.
content.html:
The UNIT_ImagesView_TEST failed in the most recent homebrew build. Here's a summary:

Default branch

On default, it fails with a timeout:

163/490 Test #163: UNIT_ImagesView_TEST ..................................***Timeout 249.17 sec

This branch

In my first jenkins test, it passed. In the most recent build, it failed, but it was a failure caused by an exception rather than a timeout:

163: Assertion failed: (!res), function ~mutex, file /Users/jenkins/jenkins.i7st/include/boost/thread/pthread/mutex.hpp, line 111.
163/490 Test #163: UNIT_ImagesView_TEST ..................................***Exception: Other308.26 sec

I believe this test will still fail intermittently for some reason, but we can address that at a later time. I believe the timeout increase in this branch is justified, despite this recent failure.
